channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Slabs uneven wit several sat significantly proud of surrounding slabbed footway and posing significant trip hazard (missed by inspectors!), 25th April
item.description:
Side of n.1 Nailsworth Terrace where OAP residents from nearby Hereford Court walk to crossing point to access Post Office, Badham's Chemist, & St.Paul's Medical Centre...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hereford Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident's drainage channel across footway is broken YET AGAIN after several botched repairs by property owner/highways contractor., 25th April
item.description:
Downpipe crossing (slotted 'acco' type) is broken again o/s n.28/27 - why can't a proper & final repair be effected here that can take the vehicular override & parking that you have sanctioned, other similar downpipe crossings v.local to this what receive similar treatment do not snap/break/collapse/etc leaving dangerous voids and trip hazards in the footway. Have reported this at least twice previously but only ever gets botched, why!? Let's get this properly fixed once and for all and finally put this issue to bed before yet more people get injured on it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Burton Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Carriageway pothole outside OAP accommodation where they cross the road, 25th April
item.description:
Near bend by Hereford Court (OAP accommodation) - pedestrian desired route across road for OAPs accessing Swindon Rd. Cannot believe it hasn't been reported nor spotted by inspectors to date!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Milsom Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole/inspection cover in carriageway is sinking again, 25th April
item.description:
('Lower') High Street, Cheltenham on outbound side of road - surely this arterial route is inspected frequently (monthly would be longest reasonable timescale) so how does this get missed? Also a carriageway pothole very near this has formed and requires remedial action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
